@template access

{{html:
<div class="account-container stacked" ng-app="cloudscalers" ng-controller="SignUpController">
    <div class="content clearfix padding">

        <h1>Sign Up</h1>

        <div class="login-fields">
            <form name="reg" ng-submit="signUp()"> <!-- name should be "reg" for some browsers to recognize it as a registration form -->
                <div class="alert alert-error ng-hide" ng-show="!isPasswordConfirmed">The passwords do not match.</div>
                <div class="alert alert-error ng-hide" ng-show="signUpError">{[signUpError]}</div>
                <div class="alert alert-success ng-hide" ng-show="signUpSuccess">Sign Up successful. Now you can <a href="/$$space/Login">login</a></div>
                <div class="field">
                    <label for="username">Username:</label>
                    <div class="input-prepend">
  						<span class="add-on"><i class="icon-user"></i></span>
                    	<input type="text" id="username" value="" placeholder="Username" ng-model="username" />
					</div>
                </div>
                <div class="field">
                    <label for="username">Email address:</label>
                     <div class="input-prepend">
  						<span class="add-on"><i class="icon-envelope"></i></span>
                    	<input type="text" id="email" value="" placeholder="Email address" ng-model="email" />
 					</div>
                </div>

                <div class="field">
                    <label for="password">Password:</label>
                    <div class="input-prepend">
  						<span class="add-on"><i class="icon-lock"></i></span>
                   		<input type="password" id="password_field" name="" value="" placeholder="Password" ng-model="password"/>
                   	</div>
                </div>

                <div class="field">
                    <label for="password">Password Confirmation:</label>
                    <div class="input-prepend">
  						<span class="add-on"><i class="icon-lock"></i></span>
                    	<input type="password" id="password_field_confirmation" name="password_confirmation" value="" placeholder="Password" 
                        	ng-model="passwordConfirmation" ng-blur="validatePasswordConfirmation()"/>
                   	</div>
                </div>
            </div>

            <div class="login-actions">
                <input type="submit" ng-disabled="!canSignUp" class="button btn  btn-primary btn-large" value="Sign Up" />
            </div>
        </form>
    </div>
</div>
}}
